pr_title: Adding a config to retry on pinot exceptions

timeline.message: Adding a config to retry on pinot exceptions
Adding a config to retry on pinot exceptions
Adding a config to retry on pinot exceptions
Adding a config to retry on pinot exceptions

timeline.bodyText: I believe we don't use the this. for member variables.
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

timeline.bodyText:
My understanding is that you intend to retry on 'fetch' exceptions in the broker and segment page source codepaths.
If so, how about having a special exception for the 'fetch' exceptions. I don't quite like the idea of having a retriable exception, if what you really want to denote is: a fetch exception that is optionally marked as retriable.
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -34,6 +34,7 @@
     PINOT_DECODE_ERROR(8, EXTERNAL),
     PINOT_INVALID_PQL_GENERATED(9, INTERNAL_ERROR),
     PINOT_INVALID_CONFIGURATION(10, INTERNAL_ERROR),
+    PINOT_RETRIABLE_EXCEPTION(11, EXTERNAL, true),

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is for data fetch request to pinot broker/server. Retry will happen if the query got timeout or server is not responding etc.
replies.author: xiangfu0

timeline.bodyText:
RetryPinotException conveys to me that the pinot exception would be retried.
How about the name: isMarkDataFetchExceptionsAsRetriable ?
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

timeline.bodyText: I think presto does not use the this. notation for instance variables
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

timeline.bodyText: Is it possible to use the config isMarkDataFetchExceptionsAsRetriable here as the third param (retriable or not) ?
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -34,6 +34,7 @@
     PINOT_DECODE_ERROR(8, EXTERNAL),
     PINOT_INVALID_PQL_GENERATED(9, INTERNAL_ERROR),
     PINOT_INVALID_CONFIGURATION(10, INTERNAL_ERROR),
+    PINOT_DATA_FETCH_EXCEPTION(11, EXTERNAL, true),

replies.bodyText: Those are enums, I don't think we can set it with the pinotConfig.
replies.author: xiangfu0

timeline.bodyText: I think we can unconditionally throw PINOT_DATA_FETCH_EXCEPTION here, if it is optionally marked as retriable elsewhere. ie, you can just make that change on line 319/326 below
timeline.author: agrawaldevesh

replies.bodyText:
I wish I could set it accordingly, but cannot find a way.
Also I prefer making this config as a session config, so user can turn it on/off along with retry count without restart presto.
replies.author: xiangfu0

replies.bodyText:
Fair enough. Can we do this on line 319/326 then ? It would be nice to keep as much of the code common if possible :-)
throw new PinotException(
      PinotSessionProperties.isMarkDataFetchExceptionsAsRetriable(session) ? PINOT_DATA_FETCH_EXCEPTION : PINOT_EXCEPTION,
                    Optional.of(pql),
                    String.format("Query %s encountered exception %s", pql, exceptions.get(0)));
replies.author: agrawaldevesh

timeline.author: agrawaldevesh
